blocks

Class ProximityDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • dangerzone.blocks.Block
      • blocks.ProximityDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PoweredComponent

    public class ProximityDetector
extends dangerzone.blocks.Block
implements PoweredComponent
    Proximity detectors activate whenever mobs are near them. Proximity detectors are designed for situations where a wide space needs to be monitored for mobs. The signal they emit is inversely proportional to the distance between the mob and the block (up to 16 blocks away; mobs further away can't be detected), and directly proportional to the number of mobs, giving the minimal signal of one for one mob 16 blocks away.
    Author:
    eaglgenes101
    See Also:
    PoweredComponent

      • basePowerLevel

        public int basePowerLevel(dangerzone.World w,
                          int d,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          int z)
        Description copied from interface: PoweredComponent
        Determines how much power this component starts with each tick. This method is called by initStep to start each powered component off with a base level of power. Go ahead and use it for yourself.
        Specified by:
        basePowerLevel in interface PoweredComponent
        Parameters:
        w - The world
        d - The dimension
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        z - The z-coordinate
        Returns:
        The power level of the block at the start of the tick (with default notifyNeighborChanged)

      • canConnect

        public boolean canConnect(int dx,
                          int dy,
                          int dz,
                          int meta)
        Description copied from interface: PoweredComponent
        Determines whether this block can send a signal to a block with the given displacement. This method is used to establish connections between active powered components. It can be assumed that dx, dy, and dz are all between -1 and 1, bit it's a good idea to check nevertheless.
        Specified by:
        canConnect in interface PoweredComponent
        Parameters:
        dx - The x-displacement of the target to this block
        dy - The y-displacement of the target to this block
        dz - The z-displacement of the target to this block
        meta - The metadata of this block
        Returns:
        Whether this block can send power to the given block
